abstract: Residents of Key Haven, Fla, are protesting proposal by Florida Keys Mosquito Control District to use their tiny Key West suburb for first United States test of genetically-modified mosquitoes to blunt spread of Zika and dengue virus; will have to chance to vote in November referendum  on releasing altered bugs into their community; plan proponents say opposition is being led by science fiction instead of facts.
lead_paragraph: Officials want to test genetically modified mosquitoes built to blunt the spread of dengue and Zika, but many Key Haven residents fear the experiment more than the viruses.
snippet: Officials want to test genetically modified mosquitoes built to blunt the spread of dengue and Zika, but many Key Haven residents fear the experiment more than the viruses....

headline.main: In Florida Keys, Some Worry About ‘Science and Government’ More Than Zika
headline.print_headline: In Florida Keys, Some Fear ‘Science and Government’ More Than Zika
